meanings.sent1: The company overhyped their new product, claiming it could do things it couldn't.
meanings.sent2: The movie was overhyped, and many people were disappointed when they saw it.
meanings.sent3: The advertisement overhyped the benefits of the miracle cream, but it didn't work as promised.
meanings.sent4: The singer's performance was overhyped as the best of the year, but it fell short of expectations.
meanings.sent5: The book was overhyped as a literary masterpiece, but it turned out to be just average.

meanings.definition: To make exaggerated claims about something.
meanings.sent1: The politician overhyped his achievements to win more votes.
meanings.sent2: The company overhyped the benefits of their new diet pill, leading to customer complaints.
meanings.sent3: The weather forecast overhyped the snowstorm, but it turned out to be just a light dusting.
meanings.sent4: The celebrity's social media post overhyped the event, but it was actually quite boring.
meanings.sent5: The advertisement overhyped the magic weight-loss tea, but it had no effect on the customers.
